newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft off, but rising.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft off, but rising.

text.p: Shares in Microsoft Corp traded slightly above the low reached in after-hours trade Friday -- a descent caused by the company's warning that operating margins in 1997 may be lower than those in 1996.
Preceding Monday's market open, the computer software giant's stock traded at 133-1/2, above the 133-1/8 reached in Friday after-hours trade but below the 134-3/8 regular-session Nasdaq close.
Microsoft also stated revenue growth rate in the 1997 first half may not approach the levels attained in 1966, which it said was high due to upgrades in Windows.
